original_title: Sri Lanka to enable addicts to seek treatment through hospitals, police
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Substance addicts will be able to seek rehabilitation through the police and hospitals in the future, justice minister Wijedasa Rajapaksa said.
“Laws are being amended so that addicts, or their relatives, can refer them for rehabilitation through the police and hospitals.”
Currently, drug addicts are referred for rehabilitation by the courts system.
Rajapaksa said congestion in prisons can be reduced by diverting more addicts to the rehabilitation process.

He said various training is provided during the rehabilitation period, such as courses in disaster management, first aid, lifesaving, environmental protection, vocational training opportunities and certificates are issued.
There are three rehabilitation centers in Kandakadu, Senapura and Vavuniya under the Bureau of the Commissioner General of Rehabilitation.
These rehabilitation centers were initially established to rehabilitate LTTE members who surrendered to the security forces, and later converted for drug addicts. (Colombo/Nov29/2023)
